Package Ex1

Class Polynom

  • java.lang.Object
    • Ex1.Polynom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    cont_function, function, Polynom_able, java.io.Serializable
    public class Polynom
extends java.lang.Object
implements Polynom_able
    This class represents a Polynom with add, multiply functionality, it also should support the following: 1. Riemann's Integral: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riemann_integral 2. Finding a numerical value between two values (currently support root only f(x)=0). 3. Derivative
    Author:
    Shaked Aviad
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Polynom

        public Polynom​(java.lang.String s)
        init a Polynom from a String such as: {"x", "3+1.4X^3-34x", "25", "-3X^78 + 14.3X" etc};
        Parameters:
        s - : is a string represents a Polynom. except: well defined Monoms (double, -, + or empty coefficient. low or capital x. natural number as power(and '^' before power)) and + / - between the Monoms. (without (,),*)

    • Method Detail

      • area

        public double area​(double x0,
                   double x1,
                   double eps)
        Compute Riemann's Integral over this Polynom starting from x0, till x1 using eps size steps. The function received x0 and x1 such as x0 need to be smaller then x1 else the function returns area = 0.
        Specified by:
        area in interface cont_function
        Parameters:
        x0 - starting point
        x1 - end point
        eps - positive step value
        Returns:
        the approximated area above the x-axis below this Polynom and between the [x0,x1] range.

      • root

        public double root​(double x0,
                   double x1,
                   double eps)
        The method root finds a solution to the function f(x)=0 between 2 points. The function received x0 and x1 such as f(x0) and f(x1) must be from the opposite side of x-line else the function will throw RuntimeException. The function received x0 and x1 such as x0 need to be smaller then x1 else the function will throw RuntimeException.
        Specified by:
        root in interface cont_function
        Parameters:
        x0 - starting point.
        x1 - end point.
        eps - the epsilon defines the accuracy amount of the function
        Returns:
        the x solution to f(x)=0.

      • add

        public void add​(Monom m1)
        This method adds a monom to the polynom. If the monom equals to zero- and the polynom is empty the function will add the zero monom else it does nothing. . If the power of the monom equals to an existing monom , the function will add them together. else the function adds the monom to the polynom.
        Specified by:
        add in interface Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        m1 - the monom that we add.

      • substract

        public void substract​(Polynom_able p1)
        This method subtract between two polynoms.
        Specified by:
        substract in interface Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        p1 - the polynom that we want to subtract with.

      • multiply

        public void multiply​(Monom m1)
        Description copied from interface: Polynom_able
        Multiply this Polynom by Monom m1
        Specified by:
        multiply in interface Polynom_able

      • multiply

        public void multiply​(Polynom_able p1)
        This method receives a polynomial p1 and multiplies it with (this). If one of the polynomial is empty the function will add the second polynomial to the empty one. If one of the polynomial equals to zero, the function will return zero. Else the function will multiply the monomial of each polynomial in mathematical order , put the answer in a new polynomial and deep copy it into (this).
        Specified by:
        multiply in interface Polynom_able

      • isZero

        public boolean isZero()
        This method returns true if this polynom contains only the zero monom.
